website_summaries.verdict: The Tribase Reign is the brand’s first attempt to create a devoted CrossFit trainer. Based on all the positive feedback that it has received, it can be considered a success. The wearers marvel at the support and stability it gives for various exercises. Its overall design has also pleased many users.The main caveat about the trainer lies in its narrow fit. It hasn't let a number of buyers enjoy the shoe’s benefits to the fullest. But for those who managed to get the right fit, this shoe has become one of the top choices for cross-training.
pros: Numerous athletes and gum buffs praise this shoe’s performance in CrossFit WODs
An expert even compared its stability to that of the Metcon 4
The majority of purchasers have marked it as true to size, lengthwise
Many buyers consider it one of the best-looking training shoes from Under Armour
Multiple users say that its sturdy outsole provides excellent grip on both the gym floor and the rope
Despite its robust construction, the trainer feels rather light on the foot, based on some reviews
The forefoot flexibility is sufficient for jumps and runs, according to an expert reviewer
cons: A significant number of negative comments mention the narrow fit of the shoe
Some wearers complain that it results in reduced stability, cramping, and blisters
Several purchasers have taken dim view of the shoe's steep price

customer_reviews.title: Fitness Friend
customer_reviews.text: The are my favorite training shoes. I immediately bought another pair after a month or two of consistent training. They are a bit snug when you get them, not enough for me to go a size up but they also loosened just the slightest over time so I stuck with the same size on my second purchase. They are comfortable in that I wear my old pair almost every day now outside of the gym. Will buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Big Bad Bear

customer_reviews.title: Not Good Enough
customer_reviews.text: I’ve worn these shoes for two months through bodybuilding, HIIT, light cardio, and CrossFit workouts. The shoe is not of the same caliber as Nike Metcon or Reebok Nano. Pros: Nice, clean look Stable for moderately heavy Olympic and power lifts Cons: Lateral support is nonexistent. Lots of heel slip Terrible arch support I’ve ended up with foot cramps twice during workouts. The first was a jump rope intensive HIIT and the other was during a Crossfit metcon with push presses. I can’t recommend the current version of this shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Average Joe X

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for Under Armour first
customer_reviews.text: Have been wearing for a couple weeks now, so decided to finally review. I feel they do come a bit narrow, it's a snug fit for sure with a good amount of room in the toe area but defintely a little too tight on the midfoot, not a deal breaker so far though. My favorite thing about these so far is the stability for squats/deadlifts and the flexibility when doing things like burpees or push presses. Love the look as well (black/gum). There is a break in period of a few days, so expect that.
customer_reviews.author: HonestlyFrank

customer_reviews.title: Perfect shoes for cross training
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my husband. He has had them now for a few months. They took a bit to break in, but they’re his new favorite cross training shoes. I bought them knowing they were a narrow shoe, personal references and the online reviews, but my husband has a narrow foot and finds them perfect. Overall he loves them!
customer_reviews.author: Bridget Howard

customer_reviews.title: Crossfitters will love this shoe
customer_reviews.text: I’m an avid crossfitter and have struggled with the metcon and the nano. I’ve been waiting for under armour to enter into this market and I wasn’t disappointed! I love these shoes, and especially the support for lifts and box jumps. I would caution buyers that the shoe isn’t great for 400m runs and longer, but I would say the same for the metcon or the nano. It’s an excellent shoe and I’ll get another pair in a different color. Trust me just buy them.
customer_reviews.author: andrew schurle

customer_reviews.title: Size & Sole
customer_reviews.text: I bought this shoe for CrossFit (5 years) and have always worn Metcons, size 11. Decided to try them, size 10.5 (bought first pair in store to get fitted correctly). This is my second pair. My favorite part is the flat grippy sole for lifting. They are also very springy for jumps/dubs, and a side grip for rope climbs. When they get too dirty you can throw them in the wash with some towels and come out like new.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Miller

customer_reviews.title: Good value CrossFit shoe
customer_reviews.text: Very good CrossFit shoe for the money. Only issue with the shoe is the back rubs my Achilles’ tendon but I’m sure it will callous soon enough. True to size but a little narrow.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Shoes go on your feet
customer_reviews.text: Like any footwear they hurt a bit at first (guess I have a wider foot than I thought) but DANG do these things keep your feet planted. I use them for deadlifts and squats and only wear them inside, in those training areas and don't walk with them much (trying to keep them stiff). 5 stars for me, they work as they should.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Pelletier

customer_reviews.title: Most comfortable training shoe!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a huge fan of under armour. I haven't bought one pair of shoes that hasn't failed me. These, however, all UA's 360 shoe, meaning i can wear them for running, training, walking and still get the same amount of comfort. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Jess & Tish

customer_reviews.title: is exactly as the picture
customer_reviews.text: they comfortable and sturdy and look exactly like in the pictures :)
customer_reviews.author: PolishGirl23

customer_reviews.title: Definitely not for wide feet
customer_reviews.text: Too small. Then when I got a size 12 they were too narrow for me. Material seems good. If you have narrow feet I would give these ones a consideration.
customer_reviews.author: C.Squatch

customer_reviews.title: Defective and Wrong Merchandise
customer_reviews.text: I spent $600 last month for 5 pair of these shoes in the size of 9.5 and one of them came 8.5 while the other one was defective. I couldn’t notice all these right-away of course and now probably over the return window by now. So I have 40% trash for top dollar shoes :(( won’t buy on-line again
customer_reviews.author: Birkan Demirtas

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: These things are sick! They look great, they're comfortable, and they feel like they'll last forever. Not even gonna lie, I'm a fat guy that walks alot for work. They seem like they'll be around for years!
customer_reviews.author: Ian Swain

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, very nice looking, fits as expected
customer_reviews.text: The shoes are very nice and looks very good with jeans. I ordered a white color one as you can see in the pic and are totally worth the money. I get a lot of compliments for this shoe. These are comfortable for sure and can stand and walk for hours in these. Fyi : the pic is after 2 months of usage
customer_reviews.author: Harsh

customer_reviews.title: Really reliable and durable
customer_reviews.text: I like the feel of the fit and how light weight it is. The only issue it doesn't do too well on tile sometimes it attempts to grip but just doesn't have a full grip as it does on concrete or any other surface.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love these.
customer_reviews.text: They look great and feel great. Using for all of my metcons and short distance runs and have no complaints. Used them for rope climbing as I didn’t come prepared with an alternative and they held up great. Won’t do that regularly but they survived quite well.
customer_reviews.author: Bryce S.

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: Hard to great in still. I don't use them everyday. Soles are really hard and probably made for flat footed people.
customer_reviews.author: Brendan Thorson

customer_reviews.title: Not very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: love under armour, but this one it's no very comfortable
customer_reviews.author: Ricky Santiago

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Under Armour sneakers..not bad
customer_reviews.text: The shoe is ok for the price but not as comfortable as you would think for the Under Armour brand.
customer_reviews.author: Melondy

customer_reviews.title: Great support for heavy weight
customer_reviews.text: Supports a ton of weight for squats etc while remaining rock-solid & stable. Very happy with these.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Schwambach

customer_reviews.title: Great Pricing
customer_reviews.text: Seems a bit large in the toe box based on the previous UnderArmour shoe and sizing. All else the shoe is great.
customer_reviews.author: Maverick

customer_reviews.title: Thanks
customer_reviews.text: I really like it I expect from Under Armour Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Alvaro Yanez

customer_reviews.title: Narrow shoe, but love the style
customer_reviews.text: This shoe is narrow! I have a triple E and it is a squeeze. I don't feel it much during the workouts, but after and walking around I can feel some discomfort. Otherwise it is a well designed shoe and does well with Olympic lifting/Crossfit
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe need break in though
customer_reviews.text: Rubber outer sole digs in foot other then that it’s great shoe
customer_reviews.author: Michael C. Schwartz

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe for a new crossfitter
customer_reviews.text: It's my first Crossfit shoe. I like the look, and feel of this shoe. The gumsole looks great and performs well
customer_reviews.author: james j santiago

customer_reviews.title: Looks good performs better
customer_reviews.text: For me it’s a little narrow but I still love This shoe. It has a lot of stability for Olympic Lifting and the flexibility for things like box jumps and burpees. I have not ran in it yet so I can’t speak to that area.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Jacob Panos

customer_reviews.title: snug fit
customer_reviews.text: This shoe hugs my foot, which is great. The top of the heal took a little bit to break in to my foot, but overall, really enjoy the fit. It feels like a part of my foot vs shoe on my foot.
customer_reviews.author: Buck Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: I don't like the hard feeling inside the shoes it becomes very uncomfortable after a while. They need to improve on that because you need to be comfortable walking in a shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Liston Billy

customer_reviews.title: Quality Shoe 🔥
customer_reviews.text: Nice shoe, fits well for a Polynesian size US14 foot both in length and width. A few comments on how they look from bypasses. Good for gym work cross for and functional movement exercises
customer_reviews.author: Kwain

customer_reviews.title: I ❤️ it
customer_reviews.text: I didn't expect that it will arrived. Although late in scheduled but it's fine. Nice Shoes 👍👍👍
customer_reviews.author: Roman Jones Salinas

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Great for strength training. Get good heel stability for your lower body workouts! Don't run in these.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Carrie

customer_reviews.title: Good training shoe
customer_reviews.text: Good fit, plenty of stability with the right amount of cushion yet still strong feedback from the soles of your feet
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: Available in 12.5, which is rare.  Very pleased with the fit.
customer_reviews.text: Very light upper with a durable yet flexible sole. Great shoe for training.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny's Pop

customer_reviews.title: They are light as a feather.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this under armour shoe so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Doyle Ates Jr

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and nice looking shoe.
customer_reviews.text: If laces are too tight shoe is uncomfortable in tie box area.
customer_reviews.author: Henry sprinkle

customer_reviews.title: Must have!
customer_reviews.text: Disliked the condition of the box. Other than that shoes are great!
customer_reviews.author: Efren Grajeda

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable cross training shoe have but many walking miles on them
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pickleball madness
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this shoe for pickle ball. The shoe is uncomfortable for running around
customer_reviews.author: ray freeman

product_meta.title: Under Armour TriBase Reign Training Shoes - 7 Black
product_meta.description: Under Armour TriBase Reign Training Shoes When you hit the gym, you need to feel as connected with the floor as possible. Every lift, rep and WOD starts from the ground up. Under Armour's TriBase technology maximises ground control with three points of contact for a low, stable base that allows natural foot flexibility. Well-constructed upper The TriBase Reign are another in a long-line of well constructed shoes from Under Armour, built using tough ripstop materials and a durable mesh for lightweight support these are the perfect gym shoe. An external heel counter has also been added for increased stability and heel lock-in helping keep your feet in place. This helps reduces the risk of injury in the gym and gives you a more comfortable and tailored fit for your feet. TriBase The outsole contains Under Armour's TriBase technology. This technology has been adapted to maximise ground contact where your foot needs it the most, allowing you to have superior upwards flexibility. This will promote natural motion and ensure downwards flexibility can grip to the ground during lifts. TriBase has been designed to ensure that when you lift, you have maximum support from your shoes and your feet giving you the solid base you need. The low to the ground construction adds to this, allowing you for greater feel and power transfer during dead-lifts. As power transfer is essential during lifts, Under Armour have constructed the shoes with a strategic rubber built under the toe box for an even more powerful floor grip making these the perfect shoes not just for lifting but for all those intense workouts. Cushioned Midsole and Durable Outsole A full-length Micro G foam midsole has been added for ultimate responsive cushioning, this ensures that the TriBase Reign give you the full support you need in the gym during any type of workout. A full-rubber outsole wraps up the lateral and medial sides of the feet providing you with maximum support all around your feet. Adding to
feature_bullets: Tough ripstop material - All-around abrasion resistance.
TriBase - Maximising ground contact where the feet need it.
External heel counter - For increased stability.
Micro G foam midsole - For ultimate responsive cushioning.
